greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Product of the nonzero digits of (n written in base 9).
mathematica: nmax = 80; A[_] = 1; Do[A[x_] = (1 + x + 2 x^2 + 3 x^3 + 4 x^4 + 5 x^5 + 6 x^6 + 7 x^7 + 8 x^8) A[x^9] + O[x]^(nmax + 1) // Normal, nmax + 1]; CoefficientList[A[x], x]
xref: Product of the nonzero digits of (n written in base k): A000012 (k = 2), A117592 (k = 3), A338854 (k = 4), A338803 (k = 5),  A338863 (k = 6), A338880 (k = 7), A338881 (k = 8), this sequence (k = 9), A051801 (k = 10).
results.author: _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Nov 13 2020
